0.name: Which operator is used to change a property of an object?

1.name: When you change the property of an object, the address to that object also changes

0.name: This statement is true if the object is created with let

1.name: This statement is true if the object is created using const

2.name: What happens if you change a property in an object created via const?

0.name: Changing the property will result in an error

1.name: The value of the property will change to the new value

2.name: No change will occur and the value of the property will remain the same

3.name: A new object will be created with the changed property
